headline: 'Years Ago, People Laughed At McDonald's Workers.' Now A Jobseeker Says Landing A Job There Feels Like A Miracle
summary: One jobseeker recently posted on Reddit that they were turned down by multiple fast food chains, despite having years of experience. “10 years ago, people laughed at McDonald’s workers,” they wrote. “Now, even landing a job there is a miracle. My applications for grocery stores, Walmart, Target, and even McDonald’s came back with automatic rejection letters.” Entry-Level Jobs Are No Longer Entry-Level Many in the thread described a job market where even so-called “wage slave” jobs are out of rea
